sentences.sContent: Everyone around him was trying to be polite, but you could tell they were all bored.
sentences.sCn: 他身边的每一个人都尽力表现得彬彬有礼，但你可以看出他们都厌倦了。

sentences.sContent: Gonzales, a quiet and very polite young man, made a favourable impression.
sentences.sCn: 冈萨雷斯是个文静而又很有礼貌的年轻人，给人留下了很好的印象。

synos.tran: 有礼貌的，客气的；文雅的；上流的；优雅的

words.tran: 有礼貌地；客气地；委婉地；殷勤地
磨光，擦亮；上光剂，擦亮剂；优雅，精良

trans.tranOther: Someone who is polite has good manners and behaves in a way that is socially correct and not rude to other people
